user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                                 const char *username,
                                 const char *realm,
                                 const char *password,
                                 void *userdigest_bin,
                                 size_t bin_buf_size)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  if (! digest_init_one_time (&da, get_base_digest_algo (algo3)))
    return MHD_NO;

  if (digest_get_size (&da) > bin_buf_size)
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
  {
    calc_userdigest (&da,
                     username,
                     strlen (username),
                     realm,
                     strlen (realm),
                     password,
                     userdigest_bin);
    ret = MHD_YES;

#ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR
    if (digest_ext_error (&da))
      ret = MHD_NO;
#endif /* MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR */
  }
  digest_deinit (&da);

  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No use of memcmp is present in the provided function. The code only calls strlen to obtain lengths and passes those lengths to calc_userdigest; there are no string comparisons performed with memcmp. Other calls in this fragment (digest_init_one_time, get_base_digest_algo, calc_userdigest, digest_get_size, digest_ext_error, digest_deinit) are function calls rather than inline uses of memcmp; based on the shown code none of the visible statements compare null‑terminated strings with memcmp, so there are no suspicious fragments to report here. (If verification across the entire codebase is required, the implementations of the called functions should be inspected for any memcmp usage on null‑terminated strings.)
